location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Coll 7/38(S) 'Muscat: export of arms and ammunition to the Persian Gulf'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in rough chronological order from the rear to the front of the file. Serial numbers in red ink refer to entries in the notes at the rear of the file (folio 7).

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 8; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: Correspondence regarding a formal visit made by the Royal Pakistan Naval vessel HMPS Jhelumto Muscat, during which a consignment of gunpowder was transported to the Sultan of Muscat. The Government of India had arranged for the transport of gunpowder three years earlier, but had been unable to effect the transfer. The correspondence provides details of the visit, which included a formal lunch for the Sultan, tea and dinner parties for officers, local notables and the royal family, and an open day for the public.
